newsitem.title: USA: Raytheon group to build India power plant.
newsitem.headline: Raytheon group to build India power plant.

text.p: Raytheon Co on Wednesday said that it was part of a group that signed a letter of intent to build a $480 million power plant in India.

The award is for a 525-megawatt coal-fired power plant in Tuticorin in the state of Tamil Nadu, Raytheon said. The plant will be built for Southern Petrochemicals Industries Corp's electric power unit.
Raytheon, the project manager, said Singapore-based Jurong Engineering Ltd and Deutsche Babcock Energie-und Umwelttechnik AG were also part of the group.
Raytheon's portion of the work is valued at about $210 million, the company said.
The power plant, which is expected to go into operation in 2001, will sell the electricity it generates to the Tamil Nadu Electricity Board, the state-owned utility, Raytheon said.
The plant will be constructed adjacent to a 1,050-megawatt plant owned by the Tamil Nadu Electricity Board, Raytheon said.
